str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Chase, pursuit; persecution. From dioko; persecution.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a presumed derivative of pathos; something undergone, i.e. Hardship or pain; subjectively, an emotion or influence.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Plural
str2: Probably akin to ho, hos, and hosos; such or what sort of; especially the neuter with negative, not so.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From Antiochus; Antiochia, a place in Syria.
Perhaps from eikon; image-like; Iconium, a place in Asia Minor.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lystra, a place in Asia Minor.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: Probably akin to ho, hos, and hosos; such or what sort of; especially the neuter with negative, not so.
Chase, pursuit; persecution. From dioko; persecution.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To bear up under, endure, suffer. From hupo and phero; to bear from underneath, i.e. to undergo hardship.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To rescue, deliver (from danger or destruction).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
